result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Werchowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit 
of 9 days was granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Comply with Day Report Program for 30 DAYS following Straight Time sentence

Follow through with any AODA treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Contact with Desmound C., Amanda M., or Michael T. Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination after treatment has been established. Court waives DNA Specimen and surcharge. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. FIRST 30 days are Straight Time. Last 30 days are Stayed for compliance with Day Report Center for 30 days.

DRC Informational Court Report.
Informational Day Report Center Report.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court directs the State to file an Amended Complaint with the additional language to substantiate the repeater.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 1 year 9 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 3 months, Extended Supervision: 6 months) STAYED.  Credit for 9 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment has been established.  No contact with Desmound C., Amanda M., or Michael T.
CONDITION TIME: 60 days to commence FORTHWITH.  First 30 days straight time.  Last 30 days stayed and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 30 days.
Hearing on May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with business/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
